info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 7:22PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR SNOW-COVERED ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES THIS EVENING... WEATHER... * Intermittent light to moderate snow showers will impact southeastern Michigan this evening. * A dusting to 1 inch of snow will be possible for areas impacted between 7 pm and 10 pm. * West winds around 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * Air temperatures will range between 23 and 28 degrees. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Embedded moderate snow showers will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile. The fluctuations of visibility may be sudden. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * The combination of moderate Snow and cold temperatures will result in localized slippery conditions and variable traffic rates throughout the county. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variability in driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
